column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Make a Top 10 List
#Text=Top 10 list are a fun and interesting way to show your opinions on how strongly you feel about a subject .
#Text=From music , actors , sightseeing and more , there are many things you can make a top 10 list about .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Pick a topic or genre that you like and that an audience can relate to for a top 10 list .
#Text=If you were to pick a topic you like then a top 10 list will be a lot easier and more enjoyable to make in the long run .
#Text=Also when it ’s a topic that a large audience can relate to more people will want to read it .
#Text=Give the list a title that relates to the list so people know what they are clicking on .
#Text=If there is n’t an accurate title or no title at all people might look at it with expectations of something else or no even look at it .
#Text=An accurate title is necessary so that you can gather the audience that you intended the list for .
#Text=Think of 10 things , places , people , or whatever your list is about where you personally think one is better than the other .
#Text=If you picked a topic that you really like but you ca n’t even think of 10 things for it , then you might want to pick a different topic .
#Text=You will also want to make sure that you can actually order these thing from least to greatest otherwise there is no point to the list .
#Text=Pick a format to put this top 10 list on whether it ’s Youtube , a slideshow , a poster , etc.
#Text=Once you have picked a platform to put it on you can find out where to put the list .
#Text=If it ’s on Youtube then you can post it on social media or if it ’s a poster then you can hand it on a wall in a classroom or public area .
#Text=Number the page or slides 1-10 starting with the number 10 and going down by one .
#Text=Numbering from 10 then going down to one will show the audience that you think 10 is the worst of the best and one is the best of the best .
#Text=Put the items , places , or people that you chose on the list from least to greatest .
#Text=Greatest being the number one slot and worst would be number 10 .
#Text=This is just the most common way to order a top 10 list .
#Text=Give a short description under every number to describe why you put that item , person , or place in the spot you did .
#Text=The description will help justify your reasoning on why someone is in that spot .
#Text=This will show the readers that agree or disagree with your opinion on why you chose it and it might even change their mind on the placement of the list .
#Text=Add some cool pictures that relate to every number as you go down the list .
#Text=These pictures can give your list a lot more flare and encourage people to read it .
#Text=If your list is just a bunch of black text on a white piece of paper might not be the most enticing to someone .
#Text=With pictures they could catch a person 's eye and draw them in .
#Text=Tips
#Text=You can make list of any thing you want .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Be careful not to make mistakes in your final copy .
#Text=If so , you have to start completely over again !
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Two pieces of paper
#Text=Pencil
